item.description:
"This survey of approximately 600 works from the Harvard Art Museums' three museums — the Fogg, the Busch-Reisinger, and the Arthur M. Sackler — is a unique installation of objects that have historically been exhibited in separate facilities" - more info here. Good news - the museum is free until noon Saturdays!

The plan is to meet in the lobby at 10:30AM, head to the top floor, and work our way down, leaving a few minutes for the gift shop and some artsy holiday shopping, then departing at noon for lunch somewhere (by consensus) in Harvard Square.

If you can possibly take the T I'd recommend doing so. Directions and parking.
item.name: Re-View at Harvard's Sackler Museum
